column4: i cant find the ATI catalyst drivers for Linux on their website
is it in the repos
use the fglrx driver. or the open source driver.
Beligal' where can i find that?

system, administration, additional drivers. if fglrx isn't listed there, then ati's proprietary linux driver doesn't support your card anymore. in which case you're already using the open source radeon drivers.
Belial' i don't see any drivers, but i have a new card by them, so it should be supported
sudo apt-get install fglrx
it says i already have it
then you're fine
fglrx is the equivalent to the catalyst driver in windows, n0a1ias.
but my resolution sucks. and I'm just getting a clone of my moniter on my second one
it's not letting you change the resolution at all?
not any higher then the resoultion of the second moniter, witch is pretty bad... Belial`
which card is it?
the 8x30
i dont remember the exact number Belial`
but i can check
i wouldn't be able to help you too much on the dual monitor issue. but as far as your main display, everything should be fine.
its the 5830 Belial`
i got the card number wrong, thats why it wasnt working
thatnks for your help Belial`
sorry man. hopefully someone here or on the board can help with your dual monitors.
